results.title: Charlie's day
results.creator_credit: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A warning, though in comic style, that pure oxygen is a hazard, and a serious one, when handled without care in hospitals and elsewhere. Charlie, a hospital orderly, creates havoc just in moving a cylinder from storeroom to bedside. The film demonstrates how oxygen makes substances more combustible, even so unlikely a material as steel wool. A film for staff training wherever oxygen is used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Chari-dogs of Fire
results.material_description: Digital screen recording of @andersonvilien's Twitter feed
results.brief_description: What cinematic trope is more iconic (and more replicated) than a good old-fashioned, dramatic slow-motion running scene? Combine it with a dramatic musical accompaniment (here, Wagner’s Ride of the Valkyries plays that role to perfection) and an eyewatering number of cute dogs, and you have the recipe for the perfect viral pet video - one that ends, fittingly, in glorious chaos.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

What cinematic trope is more iconic (and more replicated) than a good old-fashioned, dramatic slow-motion running scene? Combine it with a dramatic musical accompaniment (here, Wagner’s “Ride of the Valkyries” plays that role to perfection) and an eyewatering number of cute dogs, and you have the recipe for the perfect viral pet video - one that ends, fittingly, in glorious chaos.
description_for_label: What cinematic trope is more iconic (and more replicated) than a good old-fashioned, dramatic slow-motion running scene? results.title: Chaps on Tour 2011 [Short version]
results.brief_description: A specially made abridged version of the amazing ‘Chaps On Tour’ film, made by Toby Segar - at the age of just 16. Toby and his six friends set out to capture an image of their lives: fun and friendship driven by their mutual love of Parkour.

results.title: Charade [DVD]
results.brief_description: A Parisienne (Audrey Hepburn) finds her husband murdered. Four strange men are after her, and she is helped by a handsome stranger (Cary Grant)… but is he a hero, spy or a murderer? A mammoth audience teaser bursting with multiple identities, smart Parisian settings and Henry Mancini music. The song Charade was nominated for an Academy Award, lyrics by Johnny Mercier.

results.title: Chaplin: a character is born
results.creator_credit: Gerald A Schiller and S-L Film Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by Keenan Wynn, this film briefly traces Chaplin’s early life, his days with the Fred Karne vaudeville troupe and his film career up until the time he left Mutual Studios at the end of 1917. Extracts from many of Chaplin’s important early films are shown, including “Making a living” (1914), “Kid auto races at Venice” (1914), “The Vagabond” (1916), “the Pawnshop” (1916), “The Rink” (1916), “Easy Street” (1917), “The Immigrant” (1917) and “The Adventurer” (1917).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald A Schiller and S-L Film Productions

results.title: Chaplin (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Mario Kassar and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking are inextricably linked and brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film features one of the finest casts from the world of film and includes: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour cherished by all.

results.title: Chaplin
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Mario Kassar and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking - inextricably linked together - are brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film starring one of the finest casts from the world of film including: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour which everyone, everywhere cherished.

results.title: Chaos
results.brief_description: What makes the weather so unpredictable and volatile? Why do epidemics come and go without any discernible pattern and why do social systems, like the Stock Exchange, suffer catastrophic collapses? Could these phenomena ever be predicted? The answer may lie in an exciting mathematical theory - the Chaos Theory - put forward by an intrepid group of mathematicians and physicist. Chaos provides clues to the way in which the universe can seem both ordered and disordered at the same time. This video describes the constituent segments of the Chaos Theory and its practical applications in the real world.

results.title: Channel Seven Sport : Up There Cazaly [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
A television commercial for Channel Seven Sport’s coverage of Australian Rules Football, using the song ‘Up There Cazaly’ written by Mike Brady and Peter Sullivan. The song was inspired by the high flying marks of Roy Cazaly who played during the 1920s. The commercial shows some spectacular high marks and bruising bumps.
Produced by Campaign Palace.
